v 1.0:
• first release //Help Dialogs Browser HHS Moodle is shown in this webview. A webview displays websites in an app. If you want to be logged automatically, you must set your username and your password in the settings. In the webview there is a context menu, which opens on long pressing a link or image. You can switch back to the main screen by clicking the toolbar or the back arrow.

Swipe:
Swipe down to reload the website. Swipe right to open previous site, swipe left to move forward.

Menu:
You can make a new note or a new notification. You can share the actual moodle site as screenshot, or only the link. You can also add the actual site as bookmark, to reach it from the main screen and you can directly open the app directory.

Save bookmarks:
To save a bookmark simply click the icon at the toolbar.If you clicked the icon a popup appears. You can now edit the title of the bookmark.

Taking screenshots;
You can make screenshots of the whole website (even of the part which is outside of your display. Before taking the screenshot wait until the website is fully loaded, to ensure that the whole website is captured. My Moodle | Bookmarks

The tabs:
In the left tab you can open your personal Moodle sites and in the middle tab you can see your bookmarks.

Edit bookmarks:
Long click on a bookmark opens a popup menu. You can set your favorite bookmark (You can open the favorite ba clicking the orange \"star button\".), edit the title of the bookmark or delete it (at least one bookmark is needed). You can also create a new note or notification.


Notes

Create notes:
You can make notes if you click the \"Taking note\" entry in the menu or the pencil icon in the toolbar. If the list does not refresh automatically, you can swipe down on the picture above the list.

Working with notes:
Clicking a list entry opens the note. Long click on an entry opens a popup menu. You can edit the note or delete it (at least one note is needed).
You can also set a notification to the system status bar. A new screen for editing notifications will open. The notification will appear again after a reboot.


Menu

From the main screen you can create a new note, reach your notifications, open the app directory (where the downloaded files will be saved), enter the settings screen or create a new note. Here you can create new or edit existing notes. After editing click the \"save button\" Notifications Overview:
Here your notifications are shown. You can create a new notification from a note, a Moodle site or by clicking the \"add icon\". If you activate a notification it will be shown in status bar (even after a reboot). You can delete a notification by long clicking.

Edit notification:
Here you can create new or edit existing notifications. After editing click the \"save button\".

You can switch back to the main screen by clicking the toolbar or the back arrow. Settings To get some settings applied, you must restart the application. You can reach a short help dialog on every screen by pressing \"menu -> help\". Permission dialog Show again: Permission dialog?
